market_description: Year-round market at Luther Burbank Center for the Arts, offering fresh produce, baked goods, and local crafts.
Seasonal market (March-Dec) at the Veterans Memorial Building, featuring local produce, flowers, and artisanal goods.
A vibrant year-round market in Downtown Plaza offering fresh, locally grown produce, prepared foods, and live music.
Seasonal market (May-Nov) at Lucchesi Park featuring local produce, artisan foods, and family activities.
Seasonal evening market (May-Sept) in Walnut Park with fresh produce, prepared foods, and live music.
Community-focused market offering a wide selection of local farm products, operating year-round on Saturdays and seasonally on Tuesdays.
A long-standing seasonal market (April-Dec) showcasing Sonoma Valley's agricultural bounty at Arnold Field.
West Sonoma County market (May-Oct) with local produce, artisanal foods, and live music at Occidental Center for the Arts.
market_address: Occidental Center for the Arts parking lot, Bohemian Hwy

market_description: Family-friendly seasonal market (June-Aug) in La Plaza Park featuring local farms and food vendors.
Evening seasonal market (June-Sept) at Rohnert Park Community Center with local produce, food trucks, and entertainment.
A certified farmers market offering a wide array of local produce, artisanal goods, and prepared foods.
A charming weekly market featuring local produce, baked goods, and artisan crafts.
A small, community-focused market featuring fresh, seasonal produce from local farms.
Marin's largest farmers market, featuring local farms, artisans, and food vendors. Operates year-round.
A vibrant local market featuring fresh produce, prepared foods, and artisan goods.
Community farmers market offering fresh produce, flowers, and local products. Seasonal.
A local market in downtown Novato, offering a variety of farm-fresh produce and artisanal goods. Seasonal.
Features local farms and food producers, located at Town Center.
A small, community-focused market in West Marin, celebrating local agriculture and food. Seasonal.
Year-round farmers market operated by CUESA at the iconic Ferry Building, offering a wide selection of local produce, artisanal foods, and prepared meals. Open Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays.

market_name: Heart of the City Farmers Market
market_description: Non-profit, farmer-operated farmers market held in Civic Center's United Nations Plaza, dedicated to supporting local farmers and providing fresh produce to diverse communities. Open Wednesdays and Sundays.
market_address: United Nations Plaza, Hyde St & Market St

market_description: Sunday market with a scenic bayside setting at Fort Mason Center, featuring fresh produce, artisan foods, and prepared dishes.
Community-focused neighborhood market in Noe Valley, offering fresh produce, flowers, and local goods every Saturday.
Sunday market in the Inner Richmond neighborhood, offering fresh, seasonal produce from local farms.
A vibrant Sunday market in the Inner Sunset featuring local produce, prepared foods, and artisan goods, part of Sunset Mercantile.
Seasonal Wednesday afternoon market in the Castro District, providing fresh produce and specialty items to the community.
Established in 1947, California's first and longest-running certified farmers market, offering a vast array of fresh produce and goods every Saturday.
